title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.9 | 14-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: who miss out the rare opportunity in the human form of life to put an end to this suffering of death and disease
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and contrasts intelligent people who hear Bhagavatam with lazy, less intelligent people who waste the opportunity of human life.

segments.key_quote: less intelligent means they misuse their intelligence for material sense enjoyment
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the characteristics of lazy and less intelligent people, emphasizing the misuse of intelligence for material enjoyment and the wasting of time in Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: human form is a special gift of material nature what is that gift it is a chance to achieve the highest boon of life namely to get out of the entanglement of repeated birth and death
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the human form of life is a special gift to escape the cycle of birth and death.

segments.key_quote: one has taken birth in this material world in a material body sure to die
segments.summary: The speaker quotes the Bhagavad Gita to emphasize the cycle of birth and death and the possibility of liberation in human form.

segments.key_quote: liberation from material bondage what is that liberation from material bondage to get out of this body and get a spiritual body
segments.summary: The speaker defines material bondage and liberation, explaining the process of attaining a spiritual body and spiritual life.

segments.key_quote: simply they want to use these for enjoying enjoying enjoying enjoying material happiness material material
segments.summary: The speaker criticizes the pursuit of economic development and sense enjoyment, highlighting the temporary nature of material happiness.

segments.key_quote: even the hogs and dogs are enjoying this particularly pointed out by bhagavata
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of a hog enjoying stool to illustrate that sense pleasure is available in all forms of life, not just human life.

segments.key_quote: They work simply for sense enjoyment, that's all. But that sense enjoyment is not at all giving us happiness or real pleasure.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the momentary and unsatisfying nature of sense enjoyment with the eternal and natural pleasure of the soul.

segments.key_quote: So that is what awaits us in the human form of life if we take to Krishna consciousness.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by encouraging listeners to embrace Krishna consciousness to attain spiritual happiness.
